metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6796 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
A malicious web application running on Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M9,8.5.0 to 8.5.4, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.36, 7.0.0 to 7.0.70 and 6.0.0 to 6.0.45was able to bypass a configured SecurityManager via manipulation of theconfiguration parameters for the JSP Servlet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.8').
tomcat6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
